III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 8/27/25, a youth was observed with bruises on their right arm
and neck as a result of an assault by a staff member. During the
night, a staff member grabbed the youth by their arm tightly and
choked the youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
September 10, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Youth A said he wakes up when he wants to and goes to bed
when he wants to and will walk around outside at night because
he “feels like it”. Youth A said whenever he goes outside and
walks around the staff will normally just follow him around and try
to get him to go back inside. Youth A said on August 26, 2025, he
threw all the Legos around the unit and refused to pick them up.
Staff 3 asked if he needed to be restrained and he said he was
calm and then ran outside. Youth A said Staff 3 followed him
outside. Once outside she tried “hauling me back inside and I
pushed her away”. Youth A said Staff 3 then grabbed him by the
neck and “tried hauling me inside again so I shoved her away”.
Youth A said Staff 3 went inside. Youth A said Staff 1 was present
the whole time and was “sitting there watching”. Youth A said
during the incident he was screaming at Staff 3 and called her a
“stupid bitch”. Youth A said Staff 3 did not respond or say anything
to him during the incident. Youth A said Staff 1 did not say
anything to Staff 3 or him during the incident. Youth A said this is
the only time he has had any issues with Staff 3. Youth A said he
had bruises on his arm and scratches on his neck from Staff 3.
Youth A said Medical Assistant tried to examine him but he
refused. Youth A said the “staff” tried to bring him to the hospital
for an exam and he refused.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
September 10, 2025, in collaboration with the MDHHS Worker.
Youth B said he was “hanging out” outside with Youth A after
bedtime on August 26, 2025. Youth B said staff told them they had
to go inside so he did however Youth A remained outside. Youth B
2

said prior to going inside he did not see any marks or bruises on
Youth A. Youth B said he was not outside and did not see Youth A
until the morning of August 27, 2025, at which time Youth A had
three bruises on his arm and scratches on his neck. Youth B said
Youth A told him Staff 3 had choked him and grabbed his arm,
leaving the scratches and bruises. Youth B denied Staff 3 ever
harming him in any way.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
September 10, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Staff 1 said he works third shift and has been employed at Mott
Children’s Residence since March of 2022. Staff 1 said Youth A
had been running around outside after bedtime frequently for a
week or two. Staff 1 said when he arrived to work on August 26,
2025, Youth A was outside with three other youth on the picnic
table. Staff 1 said two of the youth AWOLed and one youth went
inside to bed. Staff 1 said Youth A remained outside alone,
refusing to go inside to bed. Staff 1 said he was following Youth A
around campus and Staff 3 came outside to check on them and
offer assistance. Staff 1 said Youth A began to yell at Staff 3,
calling her names and threatening to hit her. Staff 1 said Staff 3
did not respond or engage with Youth A but rather just followed
behind him to ensure supervision. Staff 1 said Youth A “ran up” on
Staff 3 and he stood in-between them. Staff 1 said Youth A made
a comment to Staff 3 and she responded stating “I am not talking
to you”. Staff 1 said Youth A got even more upset and ran towards
Staff 3 again, this time getting to her before he could get in-
between them. Staff 1 said “hands were flying” and Youth A got
ahold of Staff 3’s shirt collar and Staff 3 grabbed Youth A’s shirt
back. They were moving back and forth, and Youth A was “moving
his arms all around”. Staff 1 said he was attempting to get in
between them and pull them apart and they tripped on the roof
gutter, and all fell to the ground. Staff 1 said Staff 3 then was
switched out with Staff 5 and she went inside. Staff 1 said he
never saw Staff 3 swinging her arms around. Staff 1 said there
was “no way she choked him”, denying seeing her hands
anywhere near Youth A’s neck. Staff 1 said after Staff 3 went
inside, Youth A was placing his own hands around his neck
making the statement “she choked me”. Staff 1 said Youth A
continued to run around, jumping on cars, and hiding under cars
until the police arrived to assist in the situation and got Youth A to
go back inside. Staff 1 said he did not see any injury on Youth A’s
body after the incident. Staff 1 said they are trained in TCI
interventions, stating Staff 3 should not have grabbed Youth A’s
shirt as that is not part of the training. Staff 1 noted throughout the
interview Youth A does not respond well to female staff and will
3

argue and yell at them. Staff 1 said Youth A typically just wanders
around campus and one staff following him is sufficient. Staff 1
denied telling Staff 3 to go inside until after the incident had
occurred, despite Staff 3 appearing to make Youth A upset by her
presence.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
September 10, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Staff 2 said she is a youth specialist on first shift and has been
employed at Mott Children’s Residence for a year. Staff 2 said she
came into work at 6am on August 27, 2025, and Staff 6 asked her
to take a look at Youth A as he had some bruises on his neck and
arm. Staff 2 said the reason Staff 6 requested she talk to and look
at Youth A regarding his injury was because she has a good
relationship with Youth A. Staff 2 said she asked Youth A how he
got the bruises on his neck and arm. He told her Staff 3 grabbed
his arm and he pushed her away. She then grabbed his neck and
Staff 1 was there and made her let him go. She walked away after
that. Staff 2 said she had seen Youth A the morning of August 26,
2025, due to working with him and he did not have those bruises
during her shift. Staff 2 said Staff 3 was on the unit and made a
comment about not being surprised if they have to investigate her
because of the incident with Youth A. Staff 2 said she found that
comment unusual but did not ask Staff 3 why she thought it would
lead to an investigation.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
September 10, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Staff 3 said she is a third shift worker and has been employed at
Mott Children’s Residence for about a year. Staff 3 said she was
called to assist with Youth A on his unit the night of August 26,
2025. Staff 3 said when she arrived in the unit there were Lego
pieces all over the floor and she asked Youth A what was wrong
and why he threw the pieces all over the floor. Staff 3 said Youth
A did not say much to her and then responded stating “shut up
bitch, don’t talk to me”. Staff 3 said Youth A told the staff to pick
up the Lego’s and then grabbed a shampoo bottle and squeezed it
out on the floor. Staff 3 said Youth A walked off the unit and she
and Staff 1 followed him. Staff 3 said Youth A again told her “shut
up bitch, don’t talk to me”, even though she was not speaking to
him at the time due to him targeting female staff and not
responding well to them. Staff 3 said she and Staff 1 kept
following Youth A around and did not talk to him but he was yelling
and screaming the whole time. Staff 3 said Youth A kept walking
around the buildings and threatening to throw things at her. Staff 3
said she asked Youth A why he threw the Legos around “like a
4

two year old” and he charged at her, hit her left shoulder, and
grabbed her shirt and began to pull it which was starting to expose
her breasts so she kept her hands on her shirt and stayed close to
Youth A while Staff 1 got Youth A’s hands off her shirt and got in-
between them so she could move away from Youth A. Staff 3 said
she radioed for assistance so she could switch out and return
back inside. Staff 3 said she never hit Youth A, pulled his shirt,
choked him, had her hands near his neck, or physically touched
him in any way. Staff 3 denied getting upset and said she was
calm throughout the situation. Staff 3 was then shown the video
footage of the incident, afterwards she stated she should not have
reacted in the manner she did and admitted to pulling and pushing
with him in order to get him to release her clothing. Staff 3
continued to deny choking Youth A or grabbing his arms tightly.
Staff 3 said this is the first physical incident she has had with
Youth A. Staff 3 said she never saw any marks or bruises on
Youth A, stating he was very active that entire night and even tried
to climb on the roof so he “could have gotten bruising at any time
throughout the night”. Staff 3 denied telling any other staff that she
would be investigated for the incident that night. Staff 3 said she is
trained in TCI for physical interventions, however stated they do
not have training on how to intervene when a youth is pulling at
your clothing or attacking you.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on September 29, 2025,
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 said she is a third
shift worker and has been employed at Mott Children’s Residence
since December 2024. Staff 4 said she was working the night of
August 26, 2025. Youth A was very upset. He threw the Lego’s all
over the unit and began to threaten her so she called for
assistance and Staff 1 and Staff 3 responded. Staff 4 said Staff 1
and Staff 3 told Youth A he needed to pick up the Legos as it was
not fair to make someone else clean up his mess which made
Youth A even more upset. He ran outside with Staff 1 and Staff 3
following him. Staff 4 said she did not see any marks or bruises on
Youth A prior to him running outside. Staff 4 said she stayed on
the unit with all the other youth. Staff 4 said Staff 3 entered the
unit and appeared upset as she was talking really fast and said
Youth A had just hit her so Staff 1 was dealing with him and she
needed to walk away. Staff 4 denied Staff 3 making any
statements about her physically intervening with Youth A. Staff 4
denied Staff 3 making any statements about being investigated or
fired. Staff 4 said Staff 1 brought Youth A back into the unit later
that night and put him to bed. She did not see or talk to Youth A.
Staff 4 said Youth A was still sleeping when she left her shift the
next morning.
5

Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on September 29, 2025,
by MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 said he works third shift as a youth
specialist and has been employed for about six months. Staff 5
said he did not see Youth A prior to being called to assist with him
outside. Staff 5 said he has good rapport with Youth A, stating
he's been able to de-escalate him other times without issue. Staff
5 said he went outside and told Staff 3 to go to Johnson unit
because that's where he was working. Staff 5 denied Staff 3 being
upset stating she typically always had the "same mood" when she
was at work. Staff 5 denied seeing any injuries on Youth A. Staff
5 said Youth A reported Staff 3 grabbed him by the shirt and
choked him. Staff 5 said Youth A’s neck started to turn red but he
felt like this was due to him grabbing his own neck. Staff 5
admitted he did not see what happened outside prior to going to
help. Staff 5 said the police ended up coming to help get Youth A
inside the building and had told the officer that he was choked by
staff as well.
Medical Assistant was interviewed via telephone on
September 10, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Medical Assistant said she has worked in the medical office at
Mott Children’s Residence for about a year and a half. Medical
Assistant said she saw Youth A on August 27, 2025, and he had
two or three scratches on his neck. Medical Assistant said she
asked Youth A how he got the scratches, and he said, “none of
your business”. Medical Assistant said she attempted two times
on August 27, 2025, to examine Youth A’s injuries but he refused
to allow her to do so. Medical Assistant said she did not see any
bruises on Youth A.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of August 27, 2025, at 12:06am, outside in the
courtyard was reviewed on September 9, 2025. The video is
approximately eight minutes long and is from a distance across
the courtyard with some periods of time when the staff and Youth
A are blocked by bushes and trees making it difficult to see what
is fully occurring throughout the full eight minutes. Youth A is seen
walking around the courtyard area with Staff 1 and Staff 3
following him. At 12:07am, Youth A is seen moving his body into
Staff 3, who responds by grabbing Youth A, it is difficult to see
placement of her hands however it appears that it is on either side
of Youth A's body near his upper arms, and pushes and pulls him
back and forth. Staff 1 is seen moving his body between Youth A
and Staff 3 as they all move across the lawn and to the corner of
the building where Youth A and Staff 3 finally separate from one
6

another. Staff 1 begins to walks towards Youth A facing him while
Youth A is walking backwards and facing Staff 3. Youth A appears
to be trying to get around Staff 1 as Staff 3 moves towards where
they are at in the grass. Staff 1 continues to keep his body
between Youth A and Staff 3 as they move around in the grass
area. Youth A begins to advance towards Staff 3 and Staff 1 turns
Youth A and hugs him from behind and Youth A sits on the
ground. Staff 1 continues to stand over him, however it is
unknown if he was still holding him in anyway. Staff 3 then exits
the area briefly and when she walks back towards Youth A he is
seen getting up and walking to the unit doors with Staff 1 and Staff
3 following him for several minutes until Staff 5 is seen coming
outside. Staff 1, Staff 3, and Staff 5 stand near Youth A for several
minutes until the footage ends.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report dated August 26, 2025, written by Staff 1,
was consistent with his interview.
• Incident Report dated August 27, 2025, written by Staff 3,
was consistent with her interview.
• Incident Report dated August 27, 2025, written by Staff 4,
was consistent with her interview.
• Incident Report dated August 26, 2025, written by Staff 5,
was consistent with his interview.
• Medical notes for Youth A dated August 27, 2025, at
1:25pm and 4:06pm, which are consistent with Medical
Assistants interview.
• Whaley Children’s Center Physical Intervention Policy was
reviewed. The policy outlines the facilities use of
Therapeutic Crisis Intervention (TCI) model for all physical
interventions with youth. The policy outlines all prohibited
practices which includes “Hitting or striking, throwing,
kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth on any part of their
body.”
• Therapeutic Crisis Intervention manual for Physical
Restraint Skills was reviewed. The “deflecting a swing”
technique was reviewed for a youth assault and the
“release techniques” was reviewed for when a youth grabs
a staff.
• Staff 3’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 3 completed the required TCI training on June 17,
2025.
• Five photographs of Youth A were reviewed, two of his
neck and three of his arms. The photographs of his neck
showed four scratch marks in different areas of his neck as
well as some light bruising around the longest scratch. The
7

photograph was of Youth A’s right arm, there is a large
bruise with a scratch near the middle of it on his upper arm,
a large bruise on the top of his forearm which appears
lighter in color than the one on the upper arm.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per interviews and
video review, Staff 3 was pushing and pulling Youth A in response
to him shoving himself into her which is prohibited per the rules,
agency policy, and not part of the TCI training model.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
